intro: Cyrtandra ferripilosa, commonly known as the iron-hair cyrtandra, is a flowering plant belonging to the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine, rusty-colored hairs, giving it its common name. Cyrtandra ferripilosa is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky crevices.
